basics.name: Yizhe Zhang
basics.summary: Ph.D. candidate at University of Virginia, specializing in network security and machine learning.

education.studyType: Master of Science in Computer Engineering
Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering

research experience.name: University of Virginia
research experience.summary: Research focus: network security, machine learning, and internet measurement.
highlights: Developing machine learning methods to address challenges with limited, noisy, and imbalanced data in real-world network environments.
Leveraging large language models (LLMs) to tackle practical issues related to network security and privacy.
Enhancing network security in large-scale, real-world networks using machine learning, time-series analysis and graph-based techniques (published in ACSAC 23).
Conducting comprehensive assessments of network security vulnerabilities and privacy malpractices (published in IMC 23, SPW 24, and forthcoming in IMC 24).

internships.name: Maker Collider
internships.summary: Smart IoT device software development using Arduino.

skills.name: Network and Cybersecurity
keywords: Network protocols, network security and privacy.
DNS, TLS PKI, Internet of Things (IoT).
Traffic analysis, monitoring, profiling and fingerprinting.

skills.name: Machine Learning and Data Analysis
keywords: Applied machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL).
Data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.

recent publications.name: Exploring the Ecosystem of DNS HTTPS Resource Records: An End-to-End Perspective
Mutual TLS in Practice: A Deep Dive into Certificate Configurations and Privacy Issues
Intercepting Bluetooth Traffic from Wearable Health Devices
Global Analysis with Aggregation-based Beaconing Detection across Large Campus Networks
recent publications.summary: We present a new approach to effectively detect and prioritize malicious beaconing activities in large campus networks by profiling the server activities through aggregated signals across multiple traffic protocols and networks.
